name: PythonScript
description: Run a Python file or inline script
helpMarkDown: [Learn more about this task](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=2006181) or [see the Python documentation](https://www.python.org/doc/)
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: scriptSource
inputs.label: Script source
inputs.helpMarkDown: Whether the script is a file in the source tree or is written inline in this task.

inputs.name: scriptPath
inputs.label: Script path
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path of the script to execute. Must be a fully qualified path or relative to `$(System.DefaultWorkingDirectory)`.

inputs.name: arguments
inputs.label: Arguments
inputs.helpMarkDown: Arguments passed to the script execution, available through `sys.argv`.

inputs.name: pythonInterpreter
inputs.label: Python interpreter
inputs.helpMarkDown:
Absolute path to the Python interpreter to use. If not specified, the task will use the interpreter in PATH.
Run the [Use Python Version](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=871498) task to add a version of Python to PATH.

inputs.name: workingDirectory
inputs.label: Working directory
inputs.helpMarkDown: The working directory where the script will run. If not specified, the value of `System.DefaultWorkingDirectory` will be used. For builds, this variable defaults to the root of the repository. For releases, it defaults to the root of the artifacts directory.

inputs.name: failOnStderr
inputs.label: Fail on standard error
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this is true, this task will fail if any text is written to the stderr stream.

messages.NotAFile: The given path was not to a file: '%s'.
